message.content:
{"id": "108822", 
 "title": "More efficient disk sorting logic needed when there is a border value for row value", 
 "description": "Currently, the disk sorting process is not efficient when there is a border value for the row value. This can be improved by implementing a logic that sorts the data directly in memory before writing it to the file. This will enhance the overall performance of the program.", 
 "OB": "Currently, the program does not handle disk sorting efficiently when there is a border value for the row value.", 
 "EB": "The program should implement a more efficient logic for disk sorting when there is a border value for the row value. Specifically, it should sort the data directly in memory before writing it to the file.", 
 "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 
1. Set the program to sort on disk.
2. Have a dataset of 40000 rows.
3. Configure the program to process the data less than 40000 rows.
4. Observe the following operations:
   a. The file is saved as a temp file.
   b. The file is read into memory.
   c. Sorting is performed on the data.
   d. The sorted file is saved as a temp file."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:

Save the file as temp file2. Call the file to memory3. Sort on the data4. save the file to temp file5. '}
